title: "Our intention isn't just a wholesale nerfing of mages"
body:
... that being said, we're nerfing every single AP item, buffing spirit visage and banshee's veil with massively increased stats, adding more power to AD Itemization and nerfing armor items.

Seriously riot?

The rationale behind this is "we came to the conclusion that ability power was just far more efficient as a stat purchase for mages in relation to their AD brethren" which also makes no sense. AP and AD ratios differ immensely, considering that EVERY SINGLE MARKSMAN chas access to a 2.5 AD ratio on hit, (and most have access to even more, look at Draven who can pump his all the way up to 3.0, or jinx, etc). OBVIOUSLY AP will be cheaper to build, the average AP ratio hovers around .6 - .7.  

I just can't wrap my head around the sheer lack of understanding that comes from the statement that "AP items are more efficient than AD ones. If they had said "AP champions are edging out AD champions" or "We're nerfing AP items because AD items are taking a hit as well," I'd be fine. But their logic is nonsensical. It's like them nerfing Health regen items because they are "more efficient" than mana regen. I likewise can't wrap my head around the fact that somehow, riot thinks this ISNT going to shove ad dominance to a whole new level (where it's already been something of an issue this season).  Honestly, I'm at a loss. I know the designers are smart, I have no idea why they'd give such a stupid explanation that makes absolutely no sense.

*EDIT: While I appreciate the discussion, the main point of the thread (that being riot's shoddy explanation for the obvious nerfs to ap champs) has largely been unadressed.

So 2 things here:

1.) More gold in the game changes a lot of things. Mainly, time of power spikes. Meaning that if an item got it's price reduced, you can get it faster and spike earlier. So RoA getting its AP increased and price increased is meant to even out the delay in power spike with the more gold present in the game. At the same time, by normalizing common AD starting items, like Botrk, IE, and now Reaver, Riot is affecting when a lot of carries get their power spikes, that is to say they are making ADCs reach their spikes at similar times if they are even. At the same time, the overall price reduction on IE, coupled with increase gold generation, means the ADCs that run IE get that spike faster than they did before, even if the spike is weaker due to it only giving 65 AD.  

**tl:dr: Gold generation increase and item cost increase are meant to shift windows of power, not power levels directly. But you are right in that ADCs get more early game power in this case, at least the caster ADs.**

2.)  Cull vs Doran's should always go in favor of Doran's. You only buy cull if you go into lane thinking you don't want to fight/ aren't going to win lane. You are put in a serious disadvantage with Cull in a lane, relative to Doran's Blade.
